title: 412. What Happens When Everyone Stays Home to Eat?
description: Covid-19 has shocked our food-supply system like nothing in modern history. We examine the winners, the losers, the unintended consequences — and just how much toilet paper one household really needs.
author: editor@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
content:encoded: Covid-19 has shocked our food-supply system like nothing in modern history. We examine the winners, the losers, the unintended consequences — and just how much toilet paper one household really needs.
